Description: Body sherd of East Greek Wild Goat Style black-figured pottery plate; dull cream slip; interior: black-figure decoration in two friezes separated by black band with added red band lined in white; outer frieze of birds to right (chest with added red, legs, and neck of one bird remaining, body with red on feathers and belly and legs of second); incised spoked rosette and dots as filling ornament; inner frieze has most of a sphinx to right (head and part of rump missing; red on wing and body); incised splinter rosette and dots as filling ornament; to centre, part of black band with red and white remaining; underside reserved with three black bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Royal Museum of Art and History, Brussels. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Brussels III / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Belgique (p. 3, pl. 3, no. 25)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.791)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Musées Royaux d’Art et d’Histoire, Brussels
Acquisition notes: Purchased in Cairo by M. Jean de Mot
